label.en: 24/25 S regular part 2 4 CP MV Eng
label.et: 24/25 K PÕ 2. osa 4 EAP MV Eng

description.en: General principles of the microscopic structure of tissues and organs as well stages of early human embryonic development are studied. During practical classes characteristics of tissues and organs are investigated by means of examination of histological slides. The duration of the course is two semesters - in the first semester in general histology basic tissue types are studied and overview of early stages of human embryonic development is given, in the second semester in special histology microscopic structures of organs and organ systems are studied.
description.et: Käsitletakse inimese embrüonaalse arengu ja kudede ehituse üldisi printsiipe ning organite mikroskoopilist ehitust organsüsteemide kaupa. Praktikumides histoloogiliste preparaatide mikroskopeerimisel õpitakse tundma kudede ja organite ehituse iseärasusi. Kursus toimub läbi kahe semestri - esimesel semestril käsitletakse üldhistoloogia raames põhikudede ehitust ja antakse ülevaade inimese embrüonaalse arengu varastest etappidest, teisel semestril käsitletakse erihistoloogias organsüsteemide kaupa organite mikroskoopilist ehitust.

objectives.en: The course of histology aims to provide students with an understanding of the microscopic structure and development of cells, tissues and organs, with emphasis in the correlation between structure and function. The course provides a practical experience in the examination of histological slides and gives the basis of understanding of normal tissue and organ structure, which is essential in further studies in order to understand the pathological changes in the human body produced by various diseases.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda teadmisi rakkude, kudede ja organite mikroskoopilisest ehitusest ja arengust rõhuasetusega struktuuri ja funktsiooni seostele.  Kursusega antakse praktilisi oskusi histoloogiliste preparaatide mikroskopeerimisel ning tänu alusteadmiste andmisele kudede ja organite normaalsest ehitusest luuakse baas edaspidiseks mõistmaks inimkehas haiguste korral toimuvaid muutusi.

learning_outcomes.en: After the end of the course, the student should be able to:
1. Understand the essence of the steps in the preparation of histological specimens and efficiently use microscope to study histological slides
learning_outcomes.et: 1. Tunneb histoloogliste preparaatide valmistamise põhimõtteid ja oskab preparaate mikroskopeerida.

learning_outcomes.en: 2. Describe the stages of the early human embryonic development, embryogenesis of tissues and organs, and understand the causes of malformations.
learning_outcomes.et: 2. Teab inimese embrüonaalse arengu varaseid arenguetappe, kudede ja organite embrüogeneesi ja mõistab väärarengute tekkimise põhjuseid.

learning_outcomes.en: 3. Describe the structural characteristics of the basic tissue types and relate functional capabilities of each tissue type with their structure
learning_outcomes.et: 3. Suudab iseloomustada kudede põhitüüpe ja näha seoseid kudede ehituse ja funktsiooni vahel.

learning_outcomes.en: 4. Understand the basic principles of organ construction
5. Define and describe the histological characteristics of normal organs and relate the structure of organs and organ systems with the function.
learning_outcomes.et: 5. Tunneb organite normaalset mikroskoopilist struktuuri ja suudab näha seoseid organite ja organsüsteemide ehituse ja talitluse vahel.

description.et: Blood vessels. Qualitative evaluation-marks A, B, C, D, E, F. The lowermost positive mark is E.
Immune organs. Qualitative evaluation-marks A, B, C, D, E, F. The lowermost positive mark is E.
Nervous system. Qualitative evaluation-marks A, B, C, D, E, F. The lowermost positive mark is E.
Sesnsory organs. Qualitative evaluation-marks A, B, C, D, E, F. The lowermost positive mark is E.
Digestive system.  Qualitative evaluation-marks A, B, C, D, E, F. The lowermost positive mark is E.
Respiratory organs. Urinary organs. Qualitative evaluation-marks A, B, C, D, E, F. The lowermost positive mark is E.

grade_preconditions.et: Positive results in all written tests about topics of autumn and spring semester, to pass two practical microscopy preliminary examinations (the students have to recognize two histological slides and identify the major structures).

grade_evaluation.et: Determination of the examination mark  is equivalent to the % of  positive answers of the extent of the exam. Students have to be acquainted with the morphological structures of the tissues/organs and to be able to describe it fluently and logically. To know the histological terminology in Latin. Maximum 90 points can be obtained and for grading the following scale is used: A=81-90 points; B=72-80 points; C=63-71 points; D=54-62 points; E= 45-53 points; F= 0-44 points.

debt_elimination.et: According to Study regulations of Tartu University. On the basis of individual agreements with lecturers before the preliminary examination at the end of the semester.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
Textbooks in English
Anthony L. Mescher. Junqueira's Basic Histology. Text & Atlas. McGraw Hill Medical, 2013
Michael H. Ross, Wojciech Pawlina. Histology.: A Text and Atlas. Lippincott Williams & Wilkins, 2016.
